info.game_comments: (Jimmy: I'm Jimmy of the Clue Crew at the Porter Valley Country Club, making a splash today on Jeopardy!)

(1, 1).clue: Created from the earth, this man's name in Hebrew means "red earth"

(2, 1).clue: In addition to winning 4 gold medals, he set 3 Olympic records at the 1936 Olympics

(3, 1).clue: It's the "craving" that shares its name with the monetary unit of Japan

(5, 1).clue: Both Budget Rent-A-Car & this flapjack eatery were founded in 1958 & began franchising in 1960

(6, 1).clue: Boy, it was so quiet you could have heard...

(1, 2).clue: It's the numerical name for the principal works of Matthew, Mark, Luke & John

(2, 2).clue: The darling of the 1972 games, this Soviet gymnast won gold after backflipping on the balance beam

(3, 2).clue: There are 6 bashos or grand tournaments every year in this popular Japanese sport

(5, 2).clue: Main product of both Papa Murphy's & Papa John's

(6, 2).clue: I can use whatever you bring me -- it's all just...for the mill

(1, 3).clue: Matthew 10:34 recounts that Jesus, the Prince of Peace, "came not to send peace, but" this instead

(2, 3).clue: These 2 sisters-in-law have each won 3 Olympic gold medals in track & field events

(3, 3).clue: After you perform this Japanese ritual suicide, a friend or kinsman is supposed to decapitate you

(5, 3).clue: New Orleans Magazine has voted this chicken chain's red beans & rice best 11 years running

(6, 3).clue: You know what they say -- it isn't..., it's the size of the fight in the dog
(6, 3).correct response: the size of the dog in the fight

(1, 4).clue: St. Paul attended a conference in Jerusalem to decide if this "cutting" practice was required

(2, 4).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew is at the pool.)  I'm about to do a reverse 3 1/2 somersault dive just like this Olympic platform & springboard gold medalist

(3, 4).clue: Name shared by Japan's prime minister of 1901 & the judge in the O.J. Simpson trial

(5, 4).clue: Auntie Anne's Inc., a fast-growing franchise, sells the hand-rolled soft type of these treats

(6, 4).clue: Wow, you've taken care of it already?!  You don't let the grass...

(1, 5).clue: In II Samuel he laments, "Would God I had died for thee, O Absalom, my son, my son!"

(2, 5).clue: In 1980 he won gold medals in all 5 men's speed skating events

(3, 5).clue: This city was known as Kyongsong in 1911 when Japan controlled the Korean Peninsula

(5, 5).clue: Food that fills in the blank in "The Great Steak & ____ Company"

(6, 5).clue: I know you want to say what you think, but you catch more flies with honey...

(1, 1).clue: His 1964 play "After the Fall" dealt with his relationship with Marilyn Monroe, to whom he was once married

(3, 1).clue: The Pen/Faulkner Award honors this category of American writing

(4, 1).clue: Changing from standard time to this time makes some folks angry every spring

(5, 1).clue: It's the tragic year the photo seen here was snapped

(6, 1).clue: In a nursery rhyme, it's the type of animal that cries, "Wee, wee, wee, wee" all the way home

(1, 2).clue: In the '30s this "Our Town" dramatist was a lecturer on literature at the University of Chicago

(3, 2).clue: After campaigning against the nukes he developed, Andrei Sakharov didn't win the Nobel Physics Prize, but this one

(4, 2).clue: Wiggle your toe if you know this man who won the Best Actor Oscar for 1989

(5, 2).clue: The man seen here led the "Storm" in this year

(6, 2).clue: In "A League of Their Own", he's the actor who delivers the line "There's no crying in baseball!"

(1, 3).clue: His only comedy among his many plays was 1933's "Ah, Wilderness!"

(3, 3).clue: Symbolized here, it's the oldest U.S. collegiate honor society

(4, 3).clue: 180,000 dwell in this city southwest of Columbus & northeast of Cincinnati

(5, 3).clue: Down the aisle they went in this year, the same year a new U.S. president took office

(6, 3).clue: In an Aesop fable a shepherd boy tests the patience of his village by repeatedly crying this

(1, 4).clue: (Let's go to Sofia in Central Park.)  This author of "The Heidi Chronicles" wrote the libretto for an opera set here at the Bethesda Fountain

(3, 4).clue: Each year 5 Asian achievers are honored by the Ramon Magsaysay Foundation, based in this country

(4, 4).clue: It can mean a wish or fantasy that is unlikely to be fulfilled

(5, 4).clue: The haunting image seen here was snapped in this year

(6, 4).clue: In Mark 1:3 John the Baptist is described as the voice of one crying in this

(1, 5).clue: In 1935 he wrote "Waiting for Lefty" for a new Theatre League one-act play contest

(3, 5).clue: In 1985 people from IBM, Apple & Boeing won the first National Medals of this

(4, 5).clue: The Marx Brothers wreak havoc at a sanitorium in this 1937 release

(5, 5).clue: After a 16-year exile, the man seen here returned to his home country in this year

(0, 0).clue: He's the only man elected vice president twice & elected president twice
